page.title: 03SHEFFORD CHURCHES
page.content: There are four churches in Shefford. The Parish church is Saint Michael's and dates from the 14th century.It used to be a Chapel of Ease from Campton Church and shared the same rector for many centuries but now Shefford has it's own Vicar. The Catholic church is called Saint Francis' but it used to be Saint George's Chapel and was one of the first catholic churches to be built after the Catholics were made free again. The Baptist Meeting House was built in 1825. It has a very old clock in it.It was built originally for the Baptists ,the Methodists and the Bretheren but the Methodists soon built their own church. One of the Methodist families was called Inskip.There is a gravestone for Thomas Inskip who died in 1859.
